meanings.sent1: The new bike was too much of an expense for me.
meanings.sent2: I had to consider the expense of repairing my car.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't believe the expense of that tiny cup of coffee!
meanings.sent4: The expense of time is often overlooked in our busy lives.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected expense caught me off guard.

meanings.definition: An amount of money spent on something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully tracked every expense in her budget.
meanings.sent2: The business owner reviewed the monthly expenses.
meanings.sent3: The expense of buying gifts for everyone added up quickly.
meanings.sent4: His generosity knew no bounds, regardless of the expense.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected medical expense put a strain on their finances.

meanings.definition: A sacrifice made to achieve a goal.
meanings.sent1: She made the expense of sleep to finish her project on time.
meanings.sent2: The athlete knew the expense of hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his expense of eating vegetables was too high.
meanings.sent4: The expense of personal time was worth it for the success achieved.
meanings.sent5: The expense of missing the party was necessary for her exam preparation.
